00:00:02:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:02:230000.Dialogue: Leonard, are you in the shower?

00:00:04:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:04:210000.Dialogue: I can't hear you! I'm in the shower!

00:00:08:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:08:010000.Dialogue: I asked if you were in the shower, but that's moot now!

00:00:13:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:13:070000.Dialogue: Moot! Rendered unimportant by recent events!

00:00:18:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:18:030000.Dialogue: I can't hear you! I'm in the shower!

00:00:20:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:20:160000.Dialogue: I have to skip the chitchat. Emergency.

00:00:30:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:30:080000.Dialogue: You might not want to do that.

00:00:34:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:34:160000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm not alone in here.

00:00:42:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:010000.Dialogue: What are you doing in there? She can't be in here!

00:00:44:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:44:190000.Dialogue: We were in here first; you can't be in here.

00:00:47:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:47:110000.Dialogue: According to the roommate agreement, paragraph nine, subsection B, The right to bathroom privacy is suspended in the event of force majeure. And believe me, I am experiencing a very majeure force. Come on, you can't wait two minutes?

00:01:01:180000.Speaker: Priya
00:01:01:180000.Dialogue: Oh, Leonard, let the man pee.

00:01:49:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:49:060000.Dialogue: Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, you are officially charged with two violations of the roommate agreement. Do you waive reading of the charges?

00:01:59:060000.Speaker: Priya
00:01:59:060000.Dialogue: Hang on. No. My client does not waive reading of the charges.

00:02:03:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:03:020000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Oh. Cool. I've got a lawyer.

00:02:13:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:13:230000.Dialogue: Very well. Count the first: On or about the 28th day of April, the accused did knowingly and with malice aforethought deny access to the shared bathroom in a time of emergency, to wit, my back teeth were floating.

00:02:30:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:30:190000.Dialogue: Count the second: the accused exceeded the agreed upon occupancy of the shower, to wit, one, unless we are under attack by water-soluble aliens."

00:02:42:010000.Speaker: Priya
00:02:42:010000.Dialogue: Can I see the roommate agreement?

00:02:48:070000.Speaker: Priya
00:02:48:070000.Dialogue: I think I can handle it.

00:02:50:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:50:180000.Dialogue: Top of her class, Cambridge University. Licensed to practice law in three countries and your face.

00:03:02:110000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:02:110000.Dialogue: All right, based on a cursory reading, it doesn't look like you have much of a case, Sheldon.

00:03:11:020000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:11:020000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm afraid not. Section seven here, on the right to enter the bathroom in emergency situations, is not specific as to what constitutes an emergency.

00:03:20:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:20:070000.Dialogue: Oh, that's ridiculous! A bathroom emergency is self-explanatory.

00:03:23:210000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:23:210000.Dialogue: Is it? If Leonard forgot to trim his nose hair, could he barge in while you were showering?

00:03:29:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:29:080000.Dialogue: Irrelevant. Leonard doesn't trim his nose hair. He thinks because he's short nobody can see up there.

00:03:38:210000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:38:210000.Dialogue: My point is, Sheldon, the legal principle is, ambiguity in a contract benefits the party that did not draft it, in this case, Leonard. So much for count one.

00:03:48:050000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:48:050000.Dialogue: There's no buts, Sheldon; that's how the law works.

00:03:56:190000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:56:190000.Dialogue: As for the shower capacity issue, I cite addendum J. When Sheldon showers second, any and all measures shall be taken to ensure an adequate supply of hot water. I believe this supercedes the occupancy issue.

00:04:20:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:20:100000.Dialogue: No offense, but shower sex with you is now the second best thing that's happened today.

00:04:28:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:28:050000.Dialogue: Mmm, Greek food on pizza night? This is the most delightfully cruel thing we've done to Sheldon since we left that fake message from Stephen Hawking on his voice mail. (laughs)

00:04:40:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:40:010000.Dialogue: (imitating mechanical voice): I wish to discuss your theories of black holes. Meet me at the Randy's Donut by the airport at 2:00 a.m.

00:04:53:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:53:040000.Dialogue: What is that you're eating? Tonight is pizza night.

00:04:56:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:56:220000.Dialogue: I'd like to refer that to my attorney.

00:05:01:060000.Speaker: Priya
00:05:01:060000.Dialogue: According to what I see here, Thursday nights are Franconi's pizza night.

00:05:05:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:05:060000.Dialogue: Yes, and when Franconi's went out of business, we switched to Graziano's.

00:05:09:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:09:200000.Dialogue: That's interesting. Can you just switch restaurants like that, Priya?

00:05:16:090000.Speaker: Priya
00:05:16:090000.Dialogue: A good question, Howard. Turns out you can't. According to the document you drew up, Sheldon, the selection of a new takeout restaurant requires public hearings and a 60-day comment period. Were those criteria met?

00:05:43:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:43:080000.Dialogue: This is Greek food? Leonard, you hate Greek food.

00:05:54:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:54:070000.Dialogue: Fine. I'm nothing if not adaptable.

00:05:58:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:58:160000.Dialogue: I got you the lamb kabob.

00:06:24:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:24:100000.Dialogue: If you think about it, Greek food isn't that far from Italian food. They share a spice palette.

00:06:36:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:36:170000.Dialogue: And what a civilization is the Greeks'!

00:06:45:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:45:110000.Dialogue: They gave us science, democracy, and little cubes of charred meat that taste like sweat.

00:07:02:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:02:060000.Dialogue: The mean Indian lady tried to make me eat lamb.

00:07:08:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:08:090000.Dialogue: Congratulations. Pizza night will now be at your apartment. Order one.

00:07:13:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:13:050000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, honey, I'm meeting Amy and Bernadette for dinner. But you're welcome to tag along.

00:07:18:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:18:080000.Dialogue: A girls' night? Oh, I don't know if I'm up for an evening talking about rainbows, unicorns and menstrual cramps.

00:07:24:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:24:230000.Dialogue: Okay, suit yourself. We'll probably be trashing Priya a little.

00:07:33:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:33:160000.Dialogue: Okay, I'd like to propose a toast to a wonderful girls' night out.

00:07:38:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:38:020000.Dialogue: Fair warning-- we can get ca-razy.

00:07:41:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:41:180000.Dialogue: Yeah. Last week we smoked cigars and pretended to be dragons.

00:07:46:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:46:160000.Dialogue: Really, Amy? Tobacco and alcohol? Need I remind you not a lot of scientific discoveries were made by people having a good time?

00:07:57:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:57:160000.Dialogue: Why did you bring him? He's harshing my buzz.

00:08:00:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:00:230000.Dialogue: I felt sorry for him. Priya's giving him a hard time.

00:08:05:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:05:040000.Dialogue: Ooh, the Priya bashing's starting early. Yay!

00:08:09:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:09:130000.Dialogue: Okay, what's up with those pantsuits?

00:08:16:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:16:100000.Dialogue: And that opens her up to justifiable ridicule for wearing them. Good one, Bernadette.

00:08:39:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:39:090000.Dialogue: It's talc. But as that's a primary ingredient of baby powder, I understand your confusion.

00:08:46:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:46:120000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm not confused at all. You're like a sexy toddler.

00:08:54:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:54:040000.Dialogue: I don't know how to process that.

00:09:10:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:09:10:140000.Dialogue: Not if they're doing it for a long time.

00:09:15:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:15:150000.Dialogue: Sheldon... have you ever kissed a girl?

00:09:18:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:18:200000.Dialogue: Other than my mother, my sister and my Mee-Maw, no. But in the interest of full disclosure, I was once on a bus and had to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation to an elderly nun who passed out from heat exhaustion.

00:09:32:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:32:190000.Dialogue: Every year I get a Christmas card from her, signed with far too many X's and O's.

00:09:38:100000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:09:38:100000.Dialogue: That doesn't count. Aren't you even a little curious?

00:09:42:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:42:110000.Dialogue: Yeah, you're a scientist-- where is the curiosity?

00:09:52:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:52:100000.Dialogue: Thank you. Not necessary. We know everything there is to know about kissing. It requires 34 facial muscles and 112 postural muscles.

00:10:01:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:01:140000.Dialogue: Oh, blah, blah, blah. Give me some sugar, bestie.

00:10:07:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:07:230000.Dialogue: I'm certainly glad no one said they were curious about Aztec human sacrifice.

00:10:13:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:13:110000.Dialogue: Hey, I know-- let's take Sheldon dancing.

00:10:16:080000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:16:080000.Dialogue: Ooh, I totally want to see Sheldon dance. I bet he looks like a spider on a hot plate.

00:10:22:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:22:210000.Dialogue: No, thank you, but for the record, I'm an excellent dancer. Proficient in the rumba, waltz and cha-cha.

00:10:30:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:30:000000.Dialogue: I don't see why that's surprising. I excel at so many things. You've had my sourdough bread.

00:10:38:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:38:100000.Dialogue: Against my will. In the South, preadolescent children are forced through a process called cotillion, which indoctrinates them with all the social graces and dance skills needed to function in 18th century Vienna.

00:10:51:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:51:140000.Dialogue: Oh, we are so taking you dancing.

00:10:55:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:55:160000.Dialogue: No, you most certainly are not.

00:10:58:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:58:010000.Dialogue: Well, what does your cotillion training say is expected of a gentleman when three ladies ask him to escort them to a dance soiree?

00:11:08:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:08:000000.Dialogue: I saved a nun's life. Why am I being punished?

00:11:19:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:19:120000.Dialogue: Take us someplace we can waltz.

00:11:22:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:22:160000.Dialogue: Waltz. It's a social dance from Austria choreographed to a three-four time signature. Oh, waltz.

00:12:53:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:53:220000.Dialogue: How come if we're the smart people, we don't do this every night?

00:13:01:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:01:040000.Dialogue: My burps taste like cranberry juice.

00:13:09:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:09:040000.Dialogue: Would you like to come in for a nightcap?

00:13:12:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:020000.Dialogue: If you're referring to the beverage, you know I don't drink. If you're referring to the hat you don while wearing a nightshirt and holding a candle, I have one.

00:13:23:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:23:150000.Dialogue: It's hard to say no to Yoo-hoo.

00:13:48:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:48:080000.Dialogue: Don't be silly. He's one of the animals in my department's nicotine addiction study.

00:13:55:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:55:230000.Dialogue: I'm giving him emphysema. The least I can do is let him hang out and watch cable.

00:14:01:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:01:060000.Dialogue: Remarkable. Aren't you worried about secondhand smoke?

00:14:06:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:06:180000.Dialogue: A little. The real danger is him biting my face off while I'm sleeping.

00:14:14:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:070000.Dialogue: (coughs) Is he deliberately blowing smoke at me?

00:14:17:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:17:080000.Dialogue: Yeah. He's kind of an ass.

00:14:23:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:23:200000.Dialogue: Thank you. May I share something with you that's troubling me?

00:14:29:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:29:140000.Dialogue: Of course. What's rattling around that big bulbous head of yours?

00:14:33:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:33:020000.Dialogue: Priya has essentially nullified my roommate agreement with Leonard, making life in the apartment very uncomfortable for me.

00:14:41:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:41:140000.Dialogue: And you want me to kill her? Done.

00:14:46:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:46:200000.Dialogue: I trained Ricky how to smoke. I can train him to shoot a poison dart. No jury would convict us 'cause people love monkeys.

00:14:54:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:54:000000.Dialogue: I understand the alcohol has stirred up whatever it is that makes girls go wild... but I really need to talk to smart Amy now.

00:15:04:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:04:210000.Dialogue: Excuse me. Have you considered that your intelligence might be the very thing causing your dilemma?

00:15:19:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:19:170000.Dialogue: What do you think Ricky over here would do if an interloper encroached on his territory?

00:15:23:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:23:150000.Dialogue: Well, when challenged, monkeys generally assert their dominance through chasing, assault and a stylized penile display. That's a little outside my comfort zone.

00:15:36:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:36:080000.Dialogue: You're being too literal. My point is, he would not meekly surrender to the rules, and neither should you.

00:15:42:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:42:210000.Dialogue: Are you suggesting I play dirty?

00:15:55:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:55:030000.Dialogue: Which brings me to our next order of business.

00:16:04:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:04:120000.Dialogue: I hope you don't take what I'm about to do as a comment on what we just did.

00:16:23:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:23:000000.Dialogue: Who's to say you shouldn't be dissecting our brains?

00:16:35:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:35:100000.Dialogue: Oh, good, you're up. I've written a new and improved roommate agreement that benefits me greatly. I'd like you to sign it.

00:16:44:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:44:190000.Dialogue: Why would I want to do that?

00:16:46:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:46:210000.Dialogue: Excellent question. Do you remember what happened to the alien, played by talented character actor Frank Gorshin, in the Star Trek episode "Let That Be Your Last Battlefield"?

00:16:58:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:58:110000.Dialogue: Uh, Captain Kirk activated the self-destruct sequence and threatened to blow up the Enterprise and kill them both unless he gave in?

00:17:06:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:06:210000.Dialogue: Affirmative. Computer, this is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Activate self-destruct sequence. Code 1-1-A-2-B.

00:17:18:070000.Speaker: Female Voice
00:17:18:070000.Dialogue: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE: Self-destruct sequence activated.

00:17:24:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:24:210000.Dialogue: What are you gonna do, Sheldon, blow up the apartment?

00:17:28:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:28:100000.Dialogue: That was my first thought, but all my cool stuff is here.

00:17:32:200000.Speaker: Priya
00:17:32:200000.Dialogue: So what happens when it counts down?

00:17:35:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:35:100000.Dialogue: Unless Leonard signs the new agreement in the next 41 seconds, this computer will send an e-mail to your parents in India saying that you're in a secret relationship with the whiter-than-Marshmallow-Fluff Leonard Hofstadter.

00:17:53:210000.Speaker: Priya
00:17:53:210000.Dialogue: Trust me, it's a big deal.

00:17:55:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:55:100000.Dialogue: They're gonna find out about me eventually, right?

00:17:57:130000.Speaker: Priya
00:17:57:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, of course, just not today.

00:18:02:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:02:230000.Dialogue: Then why can't we tell your parents?

00:18:05:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:05:220000.Dialogue: He does that all the time, doesn't he? 15.

00:18:08:040000.Speaker: Priya
00:18:08:040000.Dialogue: Okay, fine, Sheldon, you win. Turn it off.

00:18:16:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:16:180000.Dialogue: It's a laptop with a full charge. Honestly, what do you see in him?

00:18:20:010000.Speaker: Priya
00:18:20:010000.Dialogue: Give him what he wants or we're done.

00:18:24:130000.Speaker: Female Voice
00:18:24:130000.Dialogue: FEMALE COMPUTER VOICE: Self-destruct sequence aborted.

00:18:32:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:32:150000.Dialogue: You may have gone to Cambridge,

00:18:34:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:18:34:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:34:090000.Dialogue: but I'm an honorary graduate of Starfleet Academy. Good morning, Amy.

00:18:55:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:18:55:120000.Speaker: Amy

00:18:59:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:18:59:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:59:060000.Dialogue: Are you experiencing dehydration, headache, nausea and shame?

00:19:05:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:05:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:05:200000.Dialogue: Yes. I also found a Korean man's business card tucked into my cleavage. What happened last night?

00:19:14:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:14:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:14:170000.Dialogue: Ah, memory impairment; the free prize at the bottom of every vodka bottle.

00:19:21:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:21:050000.Speaker: Amy

00:19:22:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:22:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:22:080000.Dialogue: All right. Last night you gave me some excellent advice regarding my problem here at home, you kissed me and then vomited on and off for 40 minutes, following which you passed out on your bathroom floor. I then folded a towel under your head as a pillow, set your oven clock to the correct time because it was driving me crazy...

00:19:45:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:45:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:46:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:46:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:46:170000.Dialogue: Okay. Don't really know where we go from here.

00:19:54:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:19:54:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:54:070000.Dialogue: I suggest we treat our relationship as if it were a crashed computer and restore it to the last point we both agree it worked.

00:20:01:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:20:01:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:01:220000.Dialogue: Terrific. Thank you. They were out of menthols! Get off my back!

00:20:12:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:20:12:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:12:140000.Dialogue: Not easy living with a temperamental little primate.

00:20:15:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:20:15:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:15:170000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Come on, Priya, just admit I embarrass you!

00:20:18:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
00:20:18:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:18:040000.Dialogue: You're preaching to the choir, sister.
